product_name: Chi44 Iron Guard Thermal Protection Spray
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeCHI 44 Iron Guard Thermal Protection Spray is a superior thermal protection spray that works from the inside outhelping to protect hair from thermal damage and breakage. with a weightless formula with no added build up. Helps to seal the cuticle and works to prevent future damage.
details: DetailsBenefitsWeightless formula with no added build upHelps to seal the cuticle and works to prevent future damageVitamins and proteins add essential moistureProtects against thermal damageSuitable for all hair typesItem 2113781How To UseSection hair and spray CHI 44 Iron Guard evenly over dry hair. Start using your heat tool from roots to ends.IngredientsAqua/Water/Eau,Sodium Polystyrene Sulfonate, Alcohol Denat., Polysorbate 20, Propanediol, Cocodimonium Hydroxypropyl Hydrolyzed Keratin, Hydrolyzed Silk, Caprylyl Glycol, Phenoxyethanol, PPG-20 Methyl Glucose Ether, Potassium Sorbate, Hexylene Glycol, Citric Acid, Alumina, Silica,Fragrance (Parfum), Benzyl Benzoate, Citronellol, Hexyl Cinnamal, Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891)
how_to_use: Section hair and spray CHI 44 Iron Guard evenly over dry hair. Start using your heat tool from roots to ends.

reviews.headline: Gives a shiny smooth look
reviews.comments: The spray has a nice scent and my hair looks smooth and shiny

reviews.headline: Gross/greasy residue
reviews.comments: This used to be my go-to heat protectant. Smelled amazing, kept hair healthy from all the heat I used to put on it. But they must have changed the formula in the last couple of years. This product now leaves a gross/greasy build-up on my hair after blow drying and styling with other tools. I don't use any other products and haven't changed my shampoo/conditioner. This only difference was I buying a new bottle of this. After reading more reviews, I am clearly not the only one who has noticed this. I will definitely not be purchasing this again,

reviews.headline: Bad heat protectant
reviews.comments: This product is absolutely horrible. I use this product protect my hair so I can straighten it with my flat iron but it literally fried my hair. I don't put heat on my hair very often when I try to wash my hair my curls did not revert back just from flat iron once

reviews.headline: No
reviews.comments: This left my hair feeling like I put hairspray in it. I did not over apply because I didnt want it to feel sticky and hard yet with minimal spray it left it feeling awful, I had to put way too many pumps of oil in my hair to try and soften it and it could only help so much, I ended up just washing my hair because I couldnt stand the feeling.

reviews.headline: Horrible
reviews.comments: This stuff is terrible.  It literally does the opposite of protect my hair from heat.  I have very thick, fairly healthy hair and after applying this product to dry hair and running my flat iron over my hair, the ends literally fried.  This product leaves a sticky, waxy residue.  My flat iron is at 375 degrees, I have tried it on wet and dry hair.  Do not recommend.  I gave it a chance and I fear I have passed the return period.  What a waste of money.

reviews.headline: good!!!
reviews.comments: i love the smell

reviews.headline: Greasy mess
reviews.comments: When i tell you i barely put anything on my hair and it STILL made my hair greasy. Used on both damp and dry (which on the bottle's instructions it says you can use on either) and on damp hair it wasnt as bad but still weighing my hair down. when i used it as protectant on dry hair to straighten my hair, it was beyond greasy. And for the price this just aint it

reviews.headline: 4.5 stars
reviews.comments: I used to use this brand a decade ago, and I wish I'd come back to it sooner. It does make my hair a bit sticky feeling, but it LOOKS silky and seems to do a great job preventing frizz and damage. I didn't use hairspray after, and my hair is still not frizzy despite it being in the upper 90s and humid/raining. I used this after using the all soft line of shampoo/conditioner/leave in, and it seems like the perfect combo.

reviews.headline: Not my favorite but giving it a chance
reviews.comments: I tried first with dry hair and it made my hair feel very tacky/sticky after it dried. Will be giving it another try with damp hair..

reviews.headline: I liked it!
reviews.comments: Worked great for straightening or curling my hair. A little bit goes a long way! Good price for the amount given.

reviews.headline: Amazing Product! (When used as intended!)
reviews.comments:
Make sure you read the directions on this one before you use it. It's intended to be used on DRY hair as a heat protectant hairspray with hold and it does exactly that. I was on the hunt for a heat protectant with hold that I could use before I used a waving iron on my hair and this one is perfect! I take my dry hair section by section, mist it lightly and brush the mist through before using the iron and it works beautifully. It gave my hair great shine without being greasy and it allowed me to go longer without washing my hair because the waves held up for days even after sleeping on them. 

If you're looking for a dry heat protectant with hold don't hesitate to try this one!

reviews.headline: Part of my wash and go routine
reviews.comments:
I use this as my heat protectant before diffusing. Its the preferred heat protectant before difussing.
Make sure to spritz my hold head by moving the my head and curls to expose them all. 
To avoid the tangly feeling, I break the cast with a nourishing  before I separte my curls

reviews.headline: Love it!
reviews.comments: Ive been using this for years as someone who curls their hair every weekend- I use it on DRY hair before curls. It helps hold my curls and is the best heat protectant !!! I don't recommend this on wet hair. But it def works for dry hair! A little goes a long way - and make sure your spray a good amount away from your hair. And go below your root. You gotta know how to use the product!!!

reviews.headline: Hair texture
reviews.comments: The product made my hair feel like it was always tanging, and the product made the texture of my hair nappy. Overall, it is not great but it is not bad. Since it still protects my hair.

reviews.headline: Been using for years
reviews.comments: Ok , I've been reading these reviewsâ€¦there is a way you HAVE to use it to love it. DO NOT use on wet hair! I use a moisturizing leave in with heat protectant first. Then I either air or blow dry. THEN I mist this all over hair and let it dry a couple minutes and brush through. Then you can go in with a curler or straightener and it is perfection. 10/10 when used this way

reviews.headline: Do not recommend
reviews.comments: Smells horrible and makes your hair feel dry, dticky and dull. Would not recommend

reviews.headline: Works fine
reviews.comments: Works fine, more affordable than others.

reviews.headline: Great product for my hair
reviews.comments: Always buy 2 when I go to Ulta

reviews.headline: Tried & true
reviews.comments: Always come back to this

reviews.headline: HORRIBLE SMELL
reviews.comments: i had never had a heat protectant and i decided to try this one and i hated it. It made my hair crunchy and smelly. The worst part is the smell its smells like Raid roach spray.

media.headline: Works great
media.caption: Out in the breeze and the dew held perfectly

faceoff_positive.comments: I've been using Chi Iron Guard heat protectant for years on damp hair before my blow out, with Infra Texture as a finishing spray.   I saw this at Ulta the other and decided to give it a try.   For reference, my hair is thick, but very very fine and straight.  It is cut in a chin length bob.   I use a large barrel curling iron, the way you use a flat iron.  By  that, I mean I section hair, start at the scalp and pull the iron up the hair section bending slightly as I go.  This gives fullness and a gentle curve, rather than stick straight.  I sprayed each section lightly with this Iron Guard Style and Stay spray and then curled as usual.   It is fantastic!   Gave me huge, fluffy volume with no stickiness and the volume lasted all day!   Sometimes I finish with a little Chi Infra Texture just to keep stubborn pieces in place, but in terms of the sheer volume...I haven't used anything that comes close!    Again...I can not speak for thick or curly hair but for fine hair that needs volume and is styled with a heated styling tool, I whole heartedly suggest giving this one a try.  I continue using the other heat protectant all over my damp hair before blow drying though, because hair as fine as mine needs protection for drying AND styling.
faceoff_positive.headline: Please don't stop making this!

faceoff_negative.comments:
I had high hopes for this heat protection spray, as I've used other Chi products and loved them. The first few times I used this, I was super happy because it smelled *amazing* and made my hair shiny. But, over the next few uses, I noticed my hair was going from silky (right out of bed - tangle free!) to dry, rough, and tangly immediately after straightening. I was confused because A) I was using a heat protector and B) it was instantaneous "damage" following the use of heat tools, and went away after washing. 

The product sprays on like a protecting wax, very sticky and heavy; You need to brush through it a few times after spraying before you can even think about taking a hot tool to it. I will say my hair is undamaged while using it, but it makes my hair tacky, while causing dryness and matting tangles.
faceoff_negative.headline: I had high expectations ...
